result.execSummary:
The defendant Arthur S Siewert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Arthur S Siewert is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Arthur S Siewert was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Arthur S Siewert

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from Agent Kari Stockwell dated September 8, 2017 re: paid in full
Probation review hearing on September 11, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - 1 year, New Discharge Date October 13, 2017

1:31 pm
 Defendant Arthur S Siewert in court. Agent Todd Mueller in court.
Agent makes statement that no monies have been paid.
Court finds the Defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for 1 year.
Court informs the Defendant that, if not paid, the Court will fashion conditions to include jail time.
Court instructs the Defendant regarding right to and how to obtain counsel.
Court adjourned at 1:34 pm.
Probation review hearing on September 12, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
9:25 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - will not be getting an attorney and will accept the offer from the DA.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 without repeater.  Defendant concurs.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters  a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1.  Court strikes the repeater and orders count 2 be dismissed.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

90 days county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 1 year.

CONDITIONS:

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Court costs.
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 9:31 a.m.

Defendant called and requested the status hearing scheduled on 09/22 be rescheduled as he has a funeral to attend.
43

9:48 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - is not sure about getting an attorney and has not talked with the District Attorney yet in regards to offers.  Defendant requests to talk with the District Attorney.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  Court will set for Status Hearing on September 22, 2015 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:51 a.m.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.

2:49 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty Privat enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.  Court will set for Status Hearing on August 25, 2015 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:50 p.m.
